website_summaries.verdict: Though it doesn't add any new graphics-specific capabilities over its predecessor, the Wacom Intuos5 input tablet remains a must-have for digital brushworkers.
pros: The redesigned Wacom Intuos5 fixes some drawbacks from the already-excellent previous version, plus adds multitouch operation to an already impressive bag of input tricks
cons: There's still no interface for sharing/migrating saved settings or allowing third parties to provide preconfigured application-specific settings
Also, the heads-up display trigger is a little too sensitive

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about a year but then the USB connection broke completely.  (Work around).
customer_reviews.text: Others have mentioned the USB issue in their reviews some even discuss a repair. Ours was a newer model, which seemed to break in a different fashion. I thought I'd tell about our work around to the USB connection failing. 2 other purchases made the tablet work again in wireless mode. 1) Anker Charger  2) Wacom wireless kit  Since the USB is completely broken, the battery cannot be charged by connecting to USB port. But the Anker charger works to recharge the battery. So we spent 50$ rather than another 350 for a new tablet. I wish Wacom would make these with sturdier components.
customer_reviews.author: LotusEater

customer_reviews.title: Not up to what I expect form Wacom.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Wacom tablets for years. I finally decided to treat my self to a really nice one. I'm so disappointed. The surface of the tablet is far too delicate. In less than 3 months it has worn down from it's "Paper like" surface to a glassy smooth in the center of the pad, This produces an inconsistent surface texture that is difficult to work with. I warranty replaced it once but the new one did the same thing. After 5 years my Graphire never wore out like this and it has a replaceable surface. The Intous doesn't have a replacable surface and wears out in a few months. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Best drawing tablet! So easy to use and quality!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase I could ever had made! My illustrations have greatly improved! I used to draw a picture, scan it in to a scanner, save it as PDF, and then upload it into Adobe Illustrator. Now I just draw straight in Adobe Illustrator. The pen is so easy to use. It's like drawing / sketching on a piece of paper. It offers so much versatility too. It did take me a couple of days to get used to it. The pen was sensitive and it felt different than holding a pencil. But once I got used to it, it made my work so much easier and faster. Best purchase I could have ever made as an illustrator.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Perry Moraja: Award Winning Author

customer_reviews.title: Buying refurbished...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a refurbished item. I immediately ran into problems when I tried to register it. The company I purchased it from was responsive and all my 'problems' were solved within two days. While not used to tablets yet, this proves to be a major improvement when using graphic software. Do use the free software, especially the freehand painter as it is great tool to experimentation and training. Doing so with other more sophisticated program like GIMP is frustrating especially if you are not pro efficient with them. Note: You may want to spring for the wireless adapter to avoid one more wire... Changing the stylus tips is an interesting experience that involves using pliers!!! Just weird.
customer_reviews.author: English_Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Don't compromise, get the real deal.
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea how much I needed this thing. Their other consumer grade drawing tablets let you draw, this one lets you draw & paint with super high resolution and quick, fluid access to all the needed functions - without ever touching the keyboard or mouse you can do everything you need to paint, including rotating through layers, brush sizes, moving around, switching tools. Its customizeable and insanely precise. You have to feel the solid build quality to know why the knockoff Chinese made tablets aren't worth considering at any price.
customer_reviews.author: Retail Therapist

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I'm a graphic designer and have used tablets since they became available using the parallel port. My version 1 Wacom Intuous lasted until I purchased this version 5. The build quality is as good or better, and the functionality built into it enhances daily production ad just general ease of use. The touch is straightforward and intuitive (get it?). Works well with my workstation running four portrait mode monitors driven by two nVidia graphics cards. Wacom said it wouldn't work with the portrait arrangement, but, well, that's not true. they're pricey, but they are the best, and if you're a professional, it's effectively an extension of your mind and body.
customer_reviews.author: J Clifton

customer_reviews.title: I really love this, But...
customer_reviews.text: I let me start by saying I love this tablet well worth the money. It works great for me, I got the large tablet because I do digital art. And the large tablet it BIG. Now the only thing I do not like on this tablet is the usb port on the tablet. The usb is really jiggly and loose. But I found I fix for it. I Just used some black tape (electric tape) and tape a strand around it. The tape works well and blends in with the black cord. SO all in all great tablet 5 out of 5. Would recommend to anyone after a good tablet.
customer_reviews.author: wolf

customer_reviews.title: Customizable and Responsive
customer_reviews.text: The advances they've made on these things over the years are impeccable. The touch controls, if in a good proper USB port on your computer, are smooth and responsive, the customization options are varied and wide making an application to application workflow easy and deep in control. The one down side is there are no cloning of presets from application to application; every new application starts with the 'all others' presets, which can get annoying if you're all others preset is designed for basic desktop usage like mine is. Other than that, though, I highly recommend this to all imaging professionals, one of their best designs yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan James Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Size Matters!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how i lived and worked with a smaller tablet for so long. Graduating from 8x6 (using gaff tape to mask it off to 16x9, because that is how i roll), this ginormous surface makes a WORLD of difference-- i can now use my gross motor skills to move my arm while i draw, not just the micro-movements of the wrist and hand that you have to use with smaller pads. There is a noticeable difference in the fidelity of the drawings and the reduced strain on my hand after marathon scribble sessions. The only drawback is that I had to totally re-arrange my desk to accommodate this behemoth (srsly, it is way bigger than it looks)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen D. Maxwell

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, awful service!
customer_reviews.text: The product is phenomenal, the quality is great no problem. Had so much problem getting it to work on Windows Vista. The support was of no help at all, and I really mean NO HELP! On Windows 8.1 works with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: VaNiX

customer_reviews.title: touch function not functioning well
customer_reviews.text: I've used this tablet now for about 3 weeks and like the pen input but the touch input is a hassle. When I use two fingers to scroll, it takes at least 3 attempts to get the page to move. I was using an Apple trackpad (for my MacPro desktop) and found it very responsive. I guess I got spoiled by its responsiveness--it worked fine every time, all the time. This pen tablet's touch functions are hard to get to work. Again, the pen function works fine so if that's all you care about, then this is a good choice. But if you want to use the touch functions, you'll find the responsiveness very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: rcstot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool for Graphic Design/Painting
customer_reviews.text: Hello, This is the second tablet I've ever owned (my first being a small bamboo I purchased many years ago). I have to say, this thing is HUGE (the large size). If you're lacking deskspace, skip this and go for the medium-sized one. Now, pen pressure sensitivity is fantastic, and it integrates really well with Photoshop CS6 (have not tried with other graphic programs). Installation is super easy and intuitive, and the pen & tablet was very easy to learn. I bought this in order to learn Photoshop, and I have to say, this tablet has done everything it can to make the learning process easier. It might help that I've been drawing with pen & paper for 20 years.
customer_reviews.author: chrisc

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, my daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Great little tablet, I got this for a fraction of the price it's sold for in Iceland and my daughter uses it for drawing anime, I used to have a "pen&touch" type with a lot less accuracy and also a smaller surface. This is the go to tablet for those who are serious about their drawing but not going too far money wize. These often pop up refurbished and I would consider getting a refurb to save a few bucks :)
customer_reviews.author: Karl E. Kristjánsson

customer_reviews.title: Your just going to have to try for yourself.
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of getting the large one. Don't get the large one unless you are an artist making huge sweeping strokes, it's not a good fit for the desktop. I also had the centique draw on monitor, I must not be doing it right, so far I am under impressed with both of these products but Im sure it's just me as everyone else seems to love them. I also seem to have a software conflict, the whole computer starts to go crazy, My computer is only about 2 years old, top of the line Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Pease

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this!
customer_reviews.text: BUY A DIFFERENT TABLET. The tablet driver fails 90% of the time so you can't even use pressure sensitivity; it's just a huge mouse at this point. I have tried to fix the driver issue hundreds of times over these past 4 years, and *nothing* works. It's not portable due to its size. It's clunky even if you don't need it to be portable. The tablet pen just fell apart when I tried to remove it from the elastic band of the carrying case. I have reached the end of my patience with this tablet. A waste of $310.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for just over three years (unlike my 12x12 that ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for just over three years (unlike my 12x12 that is still functional after 15+ years, if they only wrote a driver to still allow it to work (serial based, and claiming no serial port is false, as that can still be turned on, and added if needed on current systems)). Gonna cost about a third of its cost to fix its flimsy USB connector, a KNOWN and common problem. Planned obsolescence...?
customer_reviews.author: Arne Starr

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase..!!
customer_reviews.text: An Outstanding purchase..!! Superb price for a quality item, it also works Great. After registration, I only had one issue and that was when I attempted to download the free software [if you are a Lightroom/Photoshop user, don't bother] the code said it had been used. I emailed Adobe's Customer Service [Outstanding by the way], they issued me a new code and the download worked perfectly. Would not only recommend this Wacom Inuros 5 Medium Tablet, but also TheFactoryDepot..!! Cheers...
customer_reviews.author: Fritz Willy

customer_reviews.title: Another Good Intuos Tablet... But Too Many Buttons
customer_reviews.text: I was tempted to give it 4 stars because I think this product is getting overly complicated. I have another one from a few versions back, and I like that one more due to fewer buttons and no touch capability. Sometimes less is more. But I love Wacom and their Intuos line, so if you are wondering if you should get this product the answer is Yes, unless you have an older version and you don't need one of the new features. In that case, save your cash.
customer_reviews.author: AlisonA

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, great price
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet, great price. I started with a bamboo tablet but like most serious artist I wanted more after I got used to it. This was the quality I was looking for. I wish I had started with this tablet in the first place, the amount of control and customization you can eliminate the keyboard. I have been using this tablet for a little less than a year now. Also I couldn't even tell it was refurbished it looked brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: It's great except for........
customer_reviews.text: I love the Wacom tablets themselves, but there is an issue with the USB ports on every single one of them, which is why I have to give it four stars rather than five. I have a friend who has gone through four Wacom tablets, all with USB problems. I would like to see this issue be improved upon. Also, although I contacted the company two weeks ago about the USB problem, I have not heard back from them yet. Not even an acknowledgment email! Come on Wacom......I would love to give you five stars. Can you live up to it?
customer_reviews.author: the referee

customer_reviews.title: Great deer call
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked flawlessly with my mac for years
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet, poor cable connector design fails over time
customer_reviews.text: This has been disappointing. It's the best tablet available and it works very well except for the power cable socket on the tablet. It's a mini USB and it began to make poor connections shortly after we got it few years ago. Wacom repaired it at no charge which was appreciated but the problem is happening again and now its $70 to repair. It's just a bad design and for this much money its going to cost a star off this otherwise excellent tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.

customer_reviews.title: It's so great for dodging/burning
customer_reviews.text: I am not an artist, but I use this with Photoshop and Lightroom to do photo editing. Once you get used to it instead of mouse and keyboard, you can't go back. It's so great for dodging/burning. You really can't do without the pressure sensitivity. The only problem is that since it's also basically a computer mouse, it can sometimes register my hand or accidentally move the cursor if it gets touched when I'm not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Rubin

customer_reviews.title: I purchase the Wacom Intuos5 Touch Small Pen Tablet (PTH450) for use in the graphis industry.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase the Wacom Intuos5 Touch Small Pen Tablet (PTH450) for use in the graphics industry. The small is probably all one would want as the medium did not work for me on my Macbookpro 17". it was just too big for that size screen. It is a nice tool; I'm just not very good with it. There is a learning curve with this thing; after 20 year of mousing, using a pen tool is going to take some practice. One of my colleagues swears by it. I think I'll just need to keep at it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet
customer_reviews.text: I've had the 2 and 3 and the 5 is much improved. Being left handed, the wire can get annoying, so I might look into the wireless kit in the future. Note if you've never used one before and wonder about which size to buy, I've gone from the largest on the 2, medium for 3, and now the small for 5 and it's my favorite. I tend to draw small on paper and your tablet size should reflect your stroke (envision the drawing surface reflecting the whole of your screen).
customer_reviews.author: Spartakiss

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Digitizer.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Wacom 4 large with this medium tablet and the mac touch plate. Works well and is easy to use and convient. I do prefer the smaller size over the large after 3 years with the large. I am happy with this tablet and would buy this again in a minute. This is my 3rd tablet. Wacom 2, 4, and now 5. I would still be using the 4 if I had not broke my 4 when I fell. This tablet is well worth the money I spent
customer_reviews.author: John J. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a medium sized Wacom Intuos 3 tablet. I like the small size a lot better as it is faster to move across the screen but I only use my tablet for editing photos and not artwork. It's kind of weird that the tablet size itself is much larger than the drawing area but I guess it kind of helps when using it since your hand does not dangle off the side. I have yet to figure out how to use the buttons effectively because I'm so used to using the keystrokes in photoshop. The feel of the pen and nib feels a lot more sensitive than my Intuos 3.
customer_reviews.author: Milton Hee

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to install software
customer_reviews.text: We have been trying to install the software programs associated with this product for 10 months. We had a professional technician try to install them as well. We have called customer support several times. They have us repeat the same steps, we are not computer illiterate, and have followed the instructions to the letter. To say that this product is useless to us is completely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Maxie Stein

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for an amateur cartoonist, use an XRay to preserve the screen!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an amateur cartoonist from Mumbai, India. I've been using the Intuos5 for a year and it's paid for itself many times over. Fantastic tool. The touch screen is useless, though, and could totally be dispensed with. Many people complain of the screen wearing out, and nibs wearing out. This is true - I solved things easily by using an XRay on the screen. It doesn't affect my drawing in any way, though I don't know if this would hold true for those who try more intricate art than me. I don't regret this purchase at all, and would buy it if I lost mine. A bundled carry case would be dead useful, though.
customer_reviews.author: Deepak 'Chuck' Gopalakrishnan

customer_reviews.title: Really good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned and used this for several years. It has really helped me with editing photographs a lot. It is so easy to set up and takes only a couple minutes. I wish I had bought one years ago before this one.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hamm

customer_reviews.title: LOve it! Absolutely vital for my art
customer_reviews.text: LOve it! Absolutely vital for my art. Had a few issues with the connection port to the computer's usb...tried to replace the cord but it wasn't working and it turned out that there was something loose or not properly connected inside of the tablet itself. Contacted Wacom's support and like always, they did a fantastic job of fixing it up and got it back in no time!
customer_reviews.author: Pencil This

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I no longer have this as I moved up to a Cintiq, but only because of arthritis in my right wrist leading me to train my left hand to take over drawing/painting. I felt having the pen directly on the tablet might work better. Other than that as a reason for selling it, I have no other and would still be using it. It does everything you would want or expect with a tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Ted M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I will say is that it is very big. If you're using a single monitor, the medium might be big enough. Really, not much to review. It does what it says it does, and it does it better than other similar products. It takes some getting used to but that's normal. I use this for touching up photos and it has decreased my post time significantly while increasing the quality of my work.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Pirrello

customer_reviews.title: Great Pad
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing a long, long time now (4 years?) and it works flawlessly. I think the wireless things would be nice. It is a little big for the photography work I do, but what the heck - Bigger is better, right?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The touch features are kind of useful now that I have stopped using a mouse
customer_reviews.text: This tablet does work really well. The touch features are kind of useful now that I have stopped using a mouse. The only complaint I have isn't with the quality of the product, it is that I bought one size too big. I would have been fine with the medium size tablet as desk space for this one can be tricky.
customer_reviews.author: E. Caspersen

customer_reviews.title: A whole new world of touch-power!
customer_reviews.text: I am just beginning to learn all the capabilities of this wonderful little device; but, so far, I love it. I thought that I was purchasing it just for the pen, to use in creating designs; but now I find that I am keeping it connected all the time for all the touch gestures. I highly recommend this Wacom tablet to anyone who loves to play on their computer -- not just to designers.
customer_reviews.author: Snoodely

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet overall, thoroughly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 2 Wacom tablets prior to this one and this newest tablet is a nice continuation of the quality and functionality that I have come to expect of Wacoms products. The touch ring is a nice addition and the buttons not having any opening where liquids could accidentally be spilt is also nice. The touch surface for multigesture is cool, and is easily able to be disabled which is nice. Overall I'd definitely recommend this product to anyone interested in a good quality product with lots of functionality. Even with it being refurbished it works good as new. I personally prefer refurbished over new because of the inspection done and the lower price!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Hall

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tablet. I illustrate children's books in Adobe Illustrator and I love it so much, it has rendered my mouse useless. If you draw or draft, this is a fantastic product. The stylus comes with a stand and several different types of tips, which come in handy if you're looking for a particular pencil, pen, or brush type or shape. Can't say enough good things about it. I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lee Starr

customer_reviews.title: Its pricey but oh so worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. This is my 3rd Wacom and the largest one so far. Size can be an issue for a smaller desk so be cognizant of that before you buy. You may be better off with a smaller variant. Makes detail work much more manageable. Love that it is also in essence a giant track pad or mouse though it wont replace your existing navigation device. Expensive but worth it if youre in the design field.
customer_reviews.author: Shocker Allstar

customer_reviews.title: Sorry for the lack of detail, but a positive purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my wife. She loves it. Refuses to put it down. I know very little about the functionality of the item, personally. But it has lots of buttons and such that allow her to navigate Photoshop and other Adobe software suites. She says it saves her time. It makes her happy. Which, of course, makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: DutchFSU

customer_reviews.title: A great hardware piece for designing and working
customer_reviews.text: The materials are great, the intous pen feedback is really good, it takes a while to get use to it, but once you get how to use it, you won't stop using it. I went to udemy and get a free course of intous on how to use is and configure it. That gave me the advantage of using this tool the way it should.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Carlos

customer_reviews.title: still getting used to it
customer_reviews.text: i had a medium one before and now getting a large take some time to get used to. one thing is that i wish they have the "non" touch ones in large... i don't really use that and the buttons are really sensetive on the left( i did turn off the touch function) and can get annoying with the icons pop up on my screen but other than that, wacom intuos is great!
customer_reviews.author: J Norika

customer_reviews.title: More than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I've been a Wacom user for many many years—and can't work without it. I was frustratingly disappointed that I couldn't download a new driver for the new OS to continue using my good ol' reliable tablet (I hate when these things happen). Which forced me to upgrade to a new Wacom (expense unwelcome). But wow! more stuff. I'm impressed with the versatility of pen and finger drags and command keys all on the pad. I'm still learning though and trying to get use to it and being proficient with it. I think this'll solve some joint problems from using the mouse. But love it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson A

customer_reviews.title: I'm new...
customer_reviews.text: The Intuos5 medium works smoothly and and has a sleek design. I'm some what new to digital painting and had been using my iPad and creating directly on to the surface, so it's taking some getting use to the intuos5 experience. But I'm getting the hang of it using my MacBook Pro RD and a large monitor and the experience is smooth and beautiful. The only small detail which I'm sure just takes getting use to are the side command buttons could be a shade different color to be a little more easy to locate. But looking at the screen you can see the appear as you touch them. Over all the intuos5 is quite and amazing device for creating!
customer_reviews.author: C. Haugen

customer_reviews.title: BEST
customer_reviews.text: I HAVE NOT HAD A SINGLE PROBLEM WITH THIS TABLET!!! I use it to edit my photos and I am in complete love with this !!! I tried to go back to using a mouse ... aaand I cannot... this tablet has made me 100% faster in editing and I am super super happy!!!
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Small learning curve got me off to a good start. I wanted a tablet because I do photo editing but have found I use it for almost everything. After you get a feel for the pen I think it becomes faster than a mouse. Make sure you download the latest driver to perform the best for you. Good luck and enjoy your new tablet no matter which model you choose.
customer_reviews.author: cJ

customer_reviews.title: This tablet works fantastic! I did have a strange conflict after installing ...
customer_reviews.text: I do allot of work with Corel Painter X3. This tablet works fantastic! I did have a strange conflict after installing the driver the first time. Several select programs on my computer (including PainterX3) failed to launch. I removed the Intuous software, and everything was good again. This time I downloaded the latest driver version straight from Wacom's website, and everything works like a champ! I say again! This tablet is awesome!!! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Israel C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I had a small Intuos 3, and by far this is a better set up. I was going to get a Cintiq - ta da! But the cost of replacing a thousand dollar unit (plus the neg reviews about the connection wire coming loose), I am finding myself drawing ever so accurate on this! HaHa! I got to spend the excess cash on other stuff! Looove it!
customer_reviews.author: kstars

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: This is the Cadillac of tablets except for the very expensive Cintiq. I have the medium size and its just right. The large size is too big to work with for me. The small one is too teeny and doesn't allow enough movement. This mid sized unit is perfect. The on-tablet controls take a little time to get used to but its great.
customer_reviews.author: NYdirector

customer_reviews.title: had one little bug but the warranty was worth it
customer_reviews.text: an awesome drawing tablet just perfect for those large screens I had it for about 2 weeks and the Express keys stopped working but the warranty was well worth it. The functionality is very nice and the touch is very handy the only critique I have about it is that the touch is not as sensitive as I expect when you first use it but you get used to it quickly. All in all I would highly recommend best graphics tablet to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Casey R Medack

customer_reviews.title: A must have for photo retouching
customer_reviews.text: I retouch my photos using Lightroom and I was doing this for a while just with the mouse. But, when the Brush tool is in place, sometimes is not easy to do retouching and in those cases the tablet make sense. It is great to use it in rounded shapes and face retouching. Maybe the Wacom Intuos is too much for Lightroom, so the Wacom Bamboo can also do the trick at lower price. If you are a Photoshop user, then the Wacom Intuos makes a lot of sense.
customer_reviews.author: Norberto Padin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I probably should have ordered a smaller tablet for ease of carrying it, but it overall works great, and comes with everything you need. I did, however, have to look up the program to make it compatible for Mac, because my computer doesn't read CD's, but once I did, there were no further problems.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Performs as expected, and then some...
customer_reviews.text: I'm still getting used to it but is does everything it was advertised to do. Feels great. Very responsive to my Adobe Software and Windows 8.1 OS. This is a real upgrade from the Monoprice i had before and the additional software it comes with from Anime illustrations is incredible. This is a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: I am completely satisfied with this product. There were a bit of installation issues in that I caused my painting programs (including adobe, sketch book pro, etc) to crash or not work properly. I later found that the issue was uninstall all previous drivers of any previous tablets. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Niquey

customer_reviews.title: a good purchase for the digital artist
customer_reviews.text: I actually sold my old cintiq and bought this tablet! I love the new feel! It's like drawing on paper! The tablet is soooo sensitive too. Only downside is I hate the touch feature. I have to turn it off every time I use my computer. Ugh. But besides that I am a solid Wacom buyer :)
customer_reviews.author: jillian altmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, just not the right size for me. If you need something portable, then this is the tablet for you. If you're going to be at a desk all the time, go for the larger tablets. The bigger the tablet the more control you have over your strokes. The smaller tablet makes it hard to get used to, but it's usable.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: The table is a change from intuos 4
customer_reviews.text: I don't like the soft keys. I always think that they will eventually break. Also, I miss the illuminating key instructions. on the device. If you haven't changed from intuos 4 don't bother getting this. If you like the touch pad thing I guess it is ok but the the Intuos 4 is way better.
customer_reviews.author: cat9

customer_reviews.title: Re-furbished unit performs flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! This is a re-furbished unit. The tablet itself has operated flawlessly since I bought it. I did have an early issue with the windows 7 native tablet drivers interfering with the Intuos drivers. I disabled the native drivers and never had another problem. Thank you seller and well done.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Futch

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: All the buttons are a waste, my hand inadvertently activates all buttons on my he tablet. One by one I wound up deactivating each button because they would make things appear on screen when I didn't need them. I should've bought the basic one.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter and she absolutely loves it. Its refurbished but so far it works just fine. No problems with the software or anything. Took a while to get here but that was the whole UPS holiday backlog issue, but still got it in time. Everything was neatly packaged and my daughter is super happy. She prefers this one over her bamboo tablet. Overall a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: great product - I love it
customer_reviews.text: this is a great product but it does not make you an expert by any means. (I was kind of hoping) I bought it to use with my art programs but it is very extensive on learning it because it does so many things. I can do pretty good on my cad programs with very little learning.
customer_reviews.author: cautious buyer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tablet
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the extra money over the Bamboo tablets...I use this mostly with Photoshop and Lightroom. The customizeable hotkeys for each program and the extra features with the pen (additional levels of pressure, tilt sensing, more styles of tips) are very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good tablet. I like the Intuos 4 more though
customer_reviews.text: I had to pick up this tablet because of insurance following a theft. It's big. Like really big. It's larger than the intuis 4 large format tablet. Because they have brought in the touch screen features (which work ok) the surface feels a lot different and I would would say not for the better. Get an intuis 4 if you have the choice. But otherwise, it works well for a tablet and still beats a bamboo. I turn off my touch features though.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Cook

customer_reviews.title: Just want The Doctor ordered
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at getting a new Wacom tablet to replace my old Intous2 and this was exactly what I wanted. There was a lot of debate about the "refurbished" not working properly with the drivers and what not, but it worked fine for me and this thing is amazing!!! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Limited use so far, but Great nonetheless.
customer_reviews.text: Was between this and a Cintiq. Went this way do to Cost and The fact that the Cintiq doesn't support Thunderbolt just yet. The reason I needed this hasn't started yet, so I have limited use with it so far. Very easy to hook up and easy to program and use. Bought with the Wireless Accessory Kit (ACK40401) and it works without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend getting the tablet for digital post processing with your ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the small tablet for two years now, as I writeup this review. I will say, on initial use it was a little foreign feeling, but you just have to push past the feeling and keep working with it. After getting used to it, working in photoshop is much more fluid. I would highly recommend getting the tablet for digital post processing with your images.
customer_reviews.author: Neon

customer_reviews.title: This might be the only thing I bought on Ebay that wasn't a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Wacom tablets are great and this one is too. It has a great surface and looks like a Star Wars landing pad with it's light up sections. Maybe I should have just saved up for a Cintiq. I'm an idiot. Still, this is pretty great and I have had zero issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Gazin

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a web designer so this is a great tool for me. I love the massive work area of the tablet. I have a 3 monitor system (including my 27" iMac) and the pad does a really great job of gracefully and quickly moving across all 3 screens. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Foust

customer_reviews.title: great graphics pad for the ptofessional graphic designer
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift for my boyfriend who is a free lance graphic designer. He loves it and works better than he could have ever I imagined. He did say that it took some time getting to know how all the features work on it, but once you get that down easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bear Bri

customer_reviews.title: Top Of The Line
customer_reviews.text: The functions are many, the interface is elegant, and the price is fair. This purchase was a no-brainer; superior creative performance demands the proper tools. Don't compromise! Long after you have spent the money, the usefulness continues.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart E. White

customer_reviews.title: awesome tablet works great easy to use
customer_reviews.text: awesome tablet works great easy to use, setup is a breeze, drawing can be tricky for a noob but if you are an artist or draw manga and been doing it for awhile, buy it..
customer_reviews.author: T00nZ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is amazing! Even though the IntuosPros came out right after I ordered this item, after comparing; I still prefer the Intuos5 because it is wired, and I don't need a wireless tablet. I can always buy the expansion accessory for my tablet. :)
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great tool and a must have tablet if you're creating a digital drawing
customer_reviews.text: Love this Wacom pad and is the perfect size for everyday use or to take on the go. I find that even with my big screen the tablet works just as well at the smaller size - all movements are relative and feel basically the same whether using large or small tablet.
customer_reviews.author: ceebar

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I own the small Wacom tablet and noticed that my wrist was beginning to hurt. I purchased the medium tablet and it is perfect for what I need as a photographer! It is still small and portable and allows for smooth pen strokes and drawing.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Solid Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I work with a 30" IPS display at 2560x1600 resolution, so a Large Wacom is a nice tool to have. The smaller the tablet, the less precise you can be. I do all of my photoshop brushing with this guy and its been a nice addition for my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Gillespie Photography

customer_reviews.title: Too big
customer_reviews.text: I should have purchased one of the smaller pen tablets. This one forces me to move my arm while I am using it. With a smaller tables most of the motion can be done with the wrist. Other than that, it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a giant leap over the old Wacom that I had. My last one lasted for many years until I wore it out. This one seems very well designed and built, but my only issue is this, I wish I could flip it so the cord is on the other side.
customer_reviews.author: William Ambrico

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: It would have been nice if I could repurpose the airbrush and mouse from my intuos 1 and intuos 2. No bother...I bought new ones and love the ability to handle all the gestures from Windows 8, as well as the ability to scroll sideways using the ring.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb King

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this new tablet after an upgrade from my well used Wacom Bamboo tablet. It was bigger then I expected, the drawing area is HUGE! I have already put hours of use on it in a short time and the lines I am making now are crisper and more responsive then the bamboo. I should have upgraded to this tablet a long time ago. It said the package was going to be delivered on Friday and I got it 3 days earlier then that which was quite a nice surprise. I highly recommend this tablet to any artists who are working in digital mediums.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Curry

customer_reviews.title: Incredible tablet
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the Intuos5 from a Graphire4 ... holy cow. Pressure sensitivity, angle sensitivity, multiple stylus nibs, touch input, zoom wheel, and more! Will never ever go back to a regular mouse for drawing and graphics applications.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: my wife best freind
customer_reviews.text: My wife is a art director for a small company, and this tool make her life so much easier, all you have to do it get used to it and practice on it everyday since there is so much potential of this item.
customer_reviews.author: d.s

customer_reviews.title: Love my tablet
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from my old beat up but usable Wacom. The new version is sensitive to touch, love the buttons on the side. I have used a Wacom tablet for about 12 years and wouldn't use any thing else for my artwork interface with photoshop, illustrator, and dreamweaver. Glad I bought it
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Drawing Tablet!
customer_reviews.text: This tablet was very easy to install. The driver was compatible with every program. It is very responsive to the touch pen and the buttons are very useful and easy to configure. The tablet is very lightweight. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Cullen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the size of this thing! I can't imagine how large the "large" size would be, but I am very satisfied with this product and believe that it was a fantastic investment.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: This improves efficiency
customer_reviews.text: I find using this way better than using the mouse. My main post processing software is Lightroom and it works well with it. In no time you will have it configured to improve the efficiency of your workflow. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Evans

customer_reviews.title: but it's great for what I need it for
customer_reviews.text: I haven't taken time to go through all the tutorial of the buttons etc, but it's great for what I need it for. I purchased the case and a cordless mouse in addition.
customer_reviews.author: WA_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wacom is great.
customer_reviews.text: Wacom makes the best stuff out there. Keep the drivers up to date to keep problems away.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Wireless connection sucks.Everythings else works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps disconnecting ever few minutes when connected wireless. The touch recognition is great although the buttons on the left don't light up.
customer_reviews.author: Master Luis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: It is very useful tool and it is good for the health of your hand and arm if you are a heavy computer user. get rid of your mouse and buy one of these if you don't want to suffer from carpal tunnel !
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Intuos5 Touch medium size
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was a little leery that the tablet might be too small. To my surprise it is absolutely the ideal working size for a desktop. The command that I now have over editing and reviewing and changing photographs using various software packages has radically improved over a mouse. Not only is the tablet easy to use but having pressure sensitivity increasing the size of the tablets tracing path is a welcome benefit. This was indeed an excellent purchase and something that I intend to use for many years into the future. This is a terrific piece of equipment for photography.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: I would save your money and buy a Cintiq
customer_reviews.text: With the numerous Cintiq versions available now, I wouldn't hesitate on buying any of them, being able to work directly on screen is amazing. More shoulder movement is needed with this size tablet, also make sure you have the available desk space for this and a keyboard as keyboard shortcuts will still be needed when using photoshop etc. The Cintiq 13HD is definitely worth the $1000 to get into graphics tablets, save the extra cash and get the Cintiq 13HD, I guarantee if you buy the intuos 5 that in a matter of two years you'll be upgrading to a Cintiq series and wondering why you didn't do it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I work as a visual effects and motion graphics artist and have used these Intuos tablets at work for years. This tablet is great and completely worth the price if you know what you're doing.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Ricciardi

customer_reviews.title: Can Not Live Without It
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things I bought for editing my photographs. I love how I can also use the touch to search on the computer so I do not have to switch back and forth with the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: G. Embrechts

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Im 17 years old and I always liked to draw in my notebooks/etc. I want to study animation and the tablet is just perfect, I can sketch, draw, use as cursor and It does its work very well. My first tablet and I like it very much, the small size is perfect is almost the size of my 15.6" laptop. Go for it, you wont regret.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Wacom Has Done It Again!
customer_reviews.text: It will take some time to absorb all there is to this system, but what I have experienced so far is fantastic! The touch features are extremely sensitive. It's just a joy to draw and paint with. I landed a new project and promised myself an upgrade. This is it and it is terrific!
customer_reviews.author: Jaffray Clarke Rhett

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Why have I been using bamboo this whole time (2 years) to transition to digital art?! I'd say invest in an intuos medium or large and the wireless kit right off the bat.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Shortcuts are great and speed up work
customer_reviews.text: Small tablet is all you need for working on photos. Shortcuts are great and speed up work. Takes a long time for initial charging. Make sure your computer does not go to sleep as charging stops.
customer_reviews.author: George Quittner

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Good quality Tablet for a person who loves to draw any kind of anime and other mind boggling demons. The pen makes it so much easier to make an exact mark where you need it to be. Big or small. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Hood

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tablet. This size is perfect for me (I have the medium). Drawing is very smooth and natural. The default sensitivity for the pen is good but not great. Haven't tried to adjust it but it works pretty well. Working in Photoshop and Illustrator (which is what I primarily use it for) is immediately easier and more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Chauncey A

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Wacom, much better surface
customer_reviews.text: This wacom is awesome. Love the side functions and the surface is much better than the hard, textured surface for the Intuos4. Overall, we love it!
customer_reviews.author: To Infinity & Beyond

product_meta.title: Wacom Intuos5 Touch Large Pen Tablet (PTH850)
product_meta.description:
Style:LargeFROM THE MANUFACTURER



For creative professionals such as Photographers, Designers and Illustrators or anyone who desires professional results, the Intuos5 Touch Large Pen Tablet combines Wacom's most advanced pen technology with multi-touch functionality. Natural and intuitive to use, the tablet lets you alternate between using multi-touch gestures to position and navigate your artwork and the pressure-sensitive pen to sketch, paint, retouch, and edit. With 102.4 square inches of working area, the largest of the three Intuos5 touch models is preferred by those who work in large format or large dual displays.







LARGE PEN TABLET
AT A GLANCE:

 * 2048 levels of pen pressure sensitivity help you create artistic details
 * Multi-touch functionality lets you pan, rotate, and navigate your artwork
 * Eight ExpressKeys offer personalized, time-saving shortcuts
 * ExpressView display provides an on-screen view of ExpressKey settings
 * Reversible ergonomic design for left- or right-handed use
 * Two-year limited warranty






The large working surface is ideal for drawing with large strokes and working on large format artwork. View larger.



On-screen ExpressView display gives you handy reminders of your time-saving ExpressKey shortcuts. View larger.



Contoured pen and pen stand with ten replacement nibs included. View larger.




ADVANCED PEN TECHNOLOGY


To simulate traditional pens, markers, and brushes, the Intuos5 Touch Large Pen Tablet features 2048 levels of pen pressure sensitivity as well as pen tilt recognition. Varying the pressure of the pen against the tablet can create variations in line width and opacity or unique brush effects.

The Grip Pen comes with a pen stand that contains ten replacement pen nibs, including five standard nibs, one flex nib, one stroke nib, and three hard felt nibs.

MULTI-TOUCH FUNCTIONALITY


Using standard Windows and Mac multi-touch gestures, the Intuos5 Touch Large Pen Tablet lets you pan, rotate, and navigate your artwork. Multi-touch serves as an alternate input method that is both natural to use and a complementary to pen work.

The tablet's finger-sensitive Touch Ring allows you to control up to four user-defined functions, including scrolling, zooming, brush size, and canvas rotation.

TIME-SAVING EXPRESSKEYS


Use the eight ExpressKeys on the Intuos5 touch to activate your own time-saving shortcuts and modifiers in each of your tablet applications.

An ExpressView display provides on-screen reminders of your ExpressKey settings, so you can stay focused on your creative work.

COMFORTABLE, ERGONOMIC DESIGN


The Intuos5 Touch Large Pen Tablet features a soft-touch matte-black finish, gently sloping sides, ample hand support, and a contoured pen-for long hours of comfortable use.

In addition, the tablet's ergonomic design allows you to flip it for left- or right-handed use.

FREE BUNDLED SOFTWARE
Included with the tablet is a "Bundles Software Download key" that enables you to download the following valuable Bundled Software applications: Adobe Photoshop Elements, Anime Studio Debut, Autodesk Sketchbook Express, and Nik Color Effects Pro 4 Select Edition. You can also take advantage of a free 90-day trial and a special offer on Corel Painter software (Bundled Software subject to change; see www.wacom.com for more information).


DIMENSIONS AND WEIGHT
The tablet measures 12.51 by 19.18 by 0.472 inches (H x W x D) and weighs 3.97 pounds. The pen active area measures 8 by 12.8 inches (H x W), and the touch active area measures 7.5 by 11.8 inches (H x W).

CONNECTIONS AND COMPATIBILITY


The Intuos5 Touch Large Pen Tablet easily connects to your PC or Mac via USB. You can even enable a wireless connection by purchasing and installing Wacom's optional wireless accessory kit (sold separately. www.wacom.com).

The tablet is compatible with Windows PCs (Windows XP SP3, Windows Vista SP2, Windows 7 SP1, or higher) and Macs (Mac OS X 10.5.8 or later) with Intel processors.

Other computer requirements include a USB port, a color display, a CD/DVD drive, and Internet access.

TWO-YEAR WARRANTY
The Intuos5 Touch Large Pen Tablet is backed by a two-year limited warranty.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Intuos5 touch Large Pen Tablet , Grip Pen, pen stand, 10 replacement nibs (five standard nibs, one flex nib, one stroke nib, and three hard felt nibs), nib removal tool, USB cable, quick-start guide, installation CD, and Bundled Software Download Key.
feature_bullets: Quickly and professionally edit photos and create digital artwork using natural pen control
Use the new multi-touch surface to pan, zoom, navigate and more
2048 levels of pen pressure sensitivity for precise pressure control
User-defined ExpressKeys put time saving shortcuts, at your fingertips
Express View display provides an on-screen reference for each key's function, keeping you focused on your work
The finger-sensitive Touch Ring provides intuitive control of scrolling, brush size, and more
Custom radial menus for rapid navigation

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars663 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
